Hello all, Mathis from Morpho.

We know it's late in the process, but we are concerned about how breaking 7825 could be (as shared [here](https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7825-transaction-gas-limit-cap/21848/19?u=mathisgd)). The EIP isn't saying much about how breaking could it be to cap to this specific value. Also we came across [this doc](https://eips.ethereum.org/assets/eip-7825/analysis) which states that 100k transaction went above the proposed limit. This sounds like a lot, and it's very difficult to make sure that preventing them wouldn't irreversibly break stuff. Would appreciate any clarification, thanks in advance!

author: nero_eth
content:
Hey, please check out this thread that covers the (quite lengthy) discussion:
https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7987-transaction-gas-limit-cap-at-2-24/24746/21

It's a trade-off between supporting a few large transaction at the expense of scaling vs. enforcing a minimum level of parallelism for smaller txs. 
Large txs are not parallelizable. Blocks with such txs are the worst-case blocks, even if we can parallelize execution (after glamsterdam and eip 7928).
